events.title: Death of Edward the Confessor
events.description: Edward the Confessor, King of England, dies on January 5, 1066, ending the Anglo-Saxon era and triggering a disputed succession crisis that ultimately led to the Norman Conquest of England in 1066.
events.significance: With Edward's death, claims to the English throne were contested, paving the way for William the Conqueror's invasion and profound changes to English feudal structure and governance.
